item.title: Reading notes: Design Thinking by Nigel Cross
item.description: Nigel Cross: “Design Thinking.” Informative book that helps me to reflect the design (research) process as an independent researcher. Quotes “… designing is not a search for the optimum solution to the given problem, but that it is an exploratory process. The creative designer interprets the design brief not as a specification for a solution, but as a starting point for a journey of exploration; the designer sets off to explore, to discover something new, rather than to reach somewhere already known, or to return with yet another example of the already familiar.

item.title: Starting with R codes in tidyverse
item.description: Set up I’m following the R for data science book to learn some better practices for organizing my analyses. My motivation for this is that I’ve only just realized that I have been using base R for most of my previous data cleaning works – maybe I should start learning to use packages that can simplify this process. tidyverse may be the place to start (heard about it from Roger Peng and Hilary Parker’s podcast).
